news.title: Satya Nadella Put Microsoft at the Forefront of AI—and Everything Else
news.summary: Microsoft  had a market capitalization of about $300 billion in 2014, when Satya Nadella became CEO.  Today its market cap exceeds $3.5 trillion, making it one of the two largest companies in the  and the world.  Nadella, 57, upended Microsoft’s calcified corporate culture and reorganized its then-PC-centered business around cloud software and infrastructure.

news.title: Co-Chiefs Greg Peters and Ted Sarandos Have Made Netflix More Nimble
news.summary: Netflix   is the king of media.  Last year, in an entertainment industry devoid of growth, the company’s revenue rose 16%, to $39 billion, with free-cash-flow generation of $6.9 billion.  Netflix is nimble, and now willing to experiment with things it once vowed never to do.

news.title: Netflix receives Street-high target at Pivotal Research
news.summary: Investing.com -- Pivotal Research lifted its price target on Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) shares to $1,600, the highest on Wall Street, citing greater confidence in the company’s long-term market position and stronger valuation metrics.
